definition: to have a fever reaching (a certain temperature)
to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)

sentences.english: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
sentences.chinese: 在大平底鍋裏將油燒到中溫。

sentences.english: "I came back and flames were coming through the roof, " she whispers.
sentences.chinese: “當我回來時，火已經燒到了屋頂，”她低聲說道。

sentences.english: It's going to arrive at the west of Kisangani before tomorrow, I think.
sentences.chinese: 我想明天之前這火就會燒到基桑加尼西部。

sentences.english: Gradually whisk in cream. Cook until sauce is smooth and slightly thickened, whisking constantly.
sentences.chinese: 慢慢的攪入奶油，燒到沙司開始變稠，不時攪拌。

sentences.english: It's going to arrive at the west of Kisangani before tomorrow,I think.
sentences.chinese: 我想明天之前這火就會燒到基桑加尼西部。

sentences.english: She shrieked out in pain as the flames reached her leg.
sentences.chinese: 火快燒到她的腿時，她尖叫起來。

sentences.english: For instance, "she got burned by her boyfriend" or "love hurts.
sentences.chinese: 例如，“她被她的男朋友燒到了”或“感情受傷”。

sentences.english: Cook the butter until just before it turns brown, it will smell almost nutty when finished.
sentences.chinese: 黃油燒到剛好變成棕色前，發出堅果香味時即可。
